li.a: Letter to Families – District 50 Update – April 20, 2020

a.span: Read today's letter from the @HarvardD50 Board of

img.alt: Read today's letter from the @HarvardD50 Board of Education to our community, staff, and students on our website (LINK IN BIO).⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #HarvardRising

a.span: It's the 50th anniversary of Earth Day. In Harvard

img.alt: It's the 50th anniversary of Earth Day. In Harvard, we're lucky to enjoy the largest number of dedicated conservation acres in Illinois. ⠀ ⠀ Do you know the location of this picture?⠀ ⠀ #EarthDay #HarvardRising

a.span: LETTER TO FAMILIES – District 50 Update – Apri

img.alt: LETTER TO FAMILIES – District 50 Update – April 20, 2020: ⠀ ⠀ Friday’s announcement from Governor Pritzker that school would not resume in person this school year created heaps of emotions for many of us. While it wasn’t entirely a surprise, the reality of not being able to be with our students is hard on everyone. Teachers are devastated that their plans to watch your child reach their goals won’t happen in person. Students miss their friends, their sports, their concerts and performances, their teachers, and the chance to finish the school year with all the events that let us know summer has arrived. Parents are nervous about lost learning, continuing to keep their kids engaged, and how to manage life while kids stay home. It’s a tough time for all of us.⠀ ⠀ I hope that I can share some details to ease your mind and help shed light on how we’re going to move forward together...⠀ ⠀ Read the full letter from Dr. Tafoya on our website (LINK IN BIO).⠀ ⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #HarvardRising

a.span: We are seeking a District Vision Itinerant Teacher

img.alt: We are seeking a District Vision Itinerant Teacher for @HarvardD50. ⠀ ⠀ JOB SUMMARY:⠀ The Vision Itinerant Teacher serves students who require educational services due to a vision loss. The Vision Itinerant Teacher addresses the educational, communication, functional and social/emotional needs of the student and provides guidance to the student’s family and school personnel. The Vision Itinerant Teacher travels to multiple buildings to directly serve students and effectively consults with a variety of staff and teams to identify students with visual impairments and to address individual student needs.⠀ ⠀ QUALIFICATIONS:⠀ Professional Educator License (PEL) or eligible for an appropriate license Endorsement in Blind or Partially Sighted, concentration in visual impairments⠀ ⠀ Visit our CAREER PAGE on our webiste (LINK IN BIO) to apply.⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #CUSD50Careers #HarvardRising

a.span: Another image from CrosBee's book delivery adventu

img.alt: Another image from CrosBee's book delivery adventures. Additional books from @berniesbookbank will be distributed on April 30. ⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #BooksForABetterLife #HarvardRising

a.span: CrosBee made a surprise book delivery for Pre-K to

img.alt: CrosBee made a surprise book delivery for Pre-K to sixth-grade students receiving meals today. Thank you to @berniesbookbank for their donation to our students. These books mark the third time this school year Bernie's has given to @harvardd50 students. #cusd50 #BooksForABetterLife #HarvardRising

a.span: "Education Buzz – Caring for Harvard High School

img.alt: "Education Buzz – Caring for Harvard High School Students" ⠀ ⠀ Dr. Tafoya talks with Principal Carl Hobbs about the end of the year planning for Harvard High School as the community deals with the impact of COVID-19. Listen to the interview on our website (LINK IN BIO).⠀ ⠀ During this period of uncertainty, it’s critical that students connect with their teachers, counselors, and social workers. Social distancing doesn’t mean isolation. The staff of Harvard High School is here for you. ⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #HarvardRising

a.span: A Message to Harvard High School Families from Mr.

img.alt: A Message to Harvard High School Families from Mr. Hobbs:⠀ ⠀ Dear Parents and Students,⠀ ⠀ I hope this letter finds you and your family healthy and safe. None of us could have imagined that we would be using words such as a pandemic, social distancing, and quarantine during this school year. As we continue our journey together with remote learning, I continue to be very grateful that I am a part of the Hornet family. Everyone continues to be patient, flexible, caring and understanding as we all work together to get through a difficult time. Empathy and compassion are needed now more than ever and I truly appreciate how the community has come together to support one another...⠀ ⠀ Read the full message on our website (LINK IN BIO).⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #HarvardRising

a.span: From the archives: Washington students sing at the

img.alt: From the archives: Washington students sing at their winter concert.⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #HarvardRising

a.span: Students continued their e-Learning with Ms. Simmo

img.alt: Students continued their e-Learning with Ms. Simmons' kindergarten class this week.⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #HarvardRising

a.span: REMINDER: Harvard CUSD 50 closed all school playgr

img.alt: REMINDER: Harvard CUSD 50 closed all school playgrounds and athletic fields to ensure the safety of our community. We know when the sun comes out, it’s tempting to want to take advantage of the equipment and fields. However, under Illinois Governor Pritzker’s stay at home order, these areas must remain closed.⠀ ⠀ We encourage our students and community to stay healthy and active. Please consider playing outside at home or appropriate social distancing activities like walking, running, and cycling. ⠀ ⠀ Thank you for your support.⠀ -------------------------------------------------⠀ RECORDATORIO: Harvard CUSD 50 cerró todos las áreas de recreos escolares y campos deportivos para garantizar la seguridad de nuestra comunidad. Sabemos que cuando sale el sol, es tentador querer aprovechar los equipos y las áreas de recreo. Sin embargo, bajo la orden de permanecer en el hogar del gobernador de Illinois Pritzker, estas áreas deben permanecer cerradas. Alentamos a nuestros estudiantes y a la comunidad a mantenerse saludables y activos. Considere jugar afuera en casa o en hacer actividades apropiadas de distanciamiento social como caminar, correr y andar en bicicleta.⠀ ⠀ Gracias por su apoyo.⠀ ⠀ #cusd50

a.span: From the archives: Students smile at Crosby Elemen

img.alt: From the archives: Students smile at Crosby Elementary.⠀ ⠀ #cusd50 #HarvardRising
